content: Hello Mister Heine, my name is Mary Smith from the United States of America. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in Munich. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Mary Smith from the United States of America

content: Good afternoon, Mary Smith. Thank you for your interest in our apartment. We are quite pleased to have you here. As you can see, the apartment is quite cozy and well-maintained. We are open to discussing the rental price with you, but we would like to make sure that it is fair and reasonable for both parties involved. May I ask what your budget is for renting an apartment in Munich?
name: Heinrich Heine

content: I'm flexible, but I want to rent the apartment for the lowest price possible. I am a student and I want to save as much money as possible. So, I am willing to negotiate. Please let me know what you have in mind.
name: Mary Smith from the United States of America

content: Thank you for your understanding, Mary. As a landlord, my goal is to maximize my gains from renting out this apartment. However, I am also willing to negotiate and find a mutually beneficial agreement. Based on the size and location of the apartment, I am willing to consider a rental price of 800 Euros per month. This price takes into account the costs of utilities and other expenses that the tenant would be responsible for. Is this price within your budget, or would you be willing to discuss further?
name: Heinrich Heine

content:
That sounds reasonable. I can agree to that price. Thank you for your consideration.

But there is one thing I would like to add. As a student, I am looking for a long-term rental agreement. I would prefer to sign a lease for at least one year. Is that possible?

Also, I would like to clarify that I am responsible for paying for my own utilities, such as electricity and water. I will also be responsible for any damages caused to the apartment. Is that clear?

Thank you for your understanding.

I agree to the price of 800 Euros per month. Thank you for your consideration.
name: Mary Smith from the United States of America

content: Thank you for your additional information, Mary. Yes, we would be willing to consider a long-term rental agreement with you, and we can discuss the specific terms of the lease agreement during the signing process. As for utilities, we will provide you with a list of recommended service providers, but it will be your responsibility to set up and pay for your own utilities. Regarding damages, we will require a security deposit to cover any potential damages that may occur during your tenancy. We appreciate your understanding and look forward to working with you.
name: Heinrich Heine
